dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 3460 RH: State Antitrust Enforcement Venue Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Buck (for himself, Mr. Owens, Mr. Cicilline, and Mr. Bishop of North Carolina) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

Additional sponsors: Mr. Neguse, Mr. Bilirakis, Mr. Norman, Mr. Roy, Ms. Herrell, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Armstrong, Mr. Khanna, Mrs. Boebert, Mr. Schweikert, Mr. Good of Virginia, Mr. Mooney, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Jones, Mr. Nadler, Mr. Banks, Mr. DeFazio, Mr. Gooden of Texas, Mr. Budd, Mr. Cloud, Mr. Rosendale, Mr. Curtis, Mr. Van Drew, Mr. Hice of Georgia, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mr. Burgess, Mrs. Hartzler, Mr. Cole, Mr. Weber of Texas, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Hill, Mr. Meuser, Mr. Williams of Texas, Mr. Cline, Mr. Kustoff, and Mr. Smith of Missouri
Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on May 21, 2021

form.official-title: To amend title 28 of the United States Code to prevent the transfer of actions arising under the antitrust laws in which a State is a complainant.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the State Antitrust Enforcement Venue Act of 2022.
Section 1407 of title 28 of the United States Code is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (g) by inserting or a State after United States, and

section.text: This Act and the amendments made by this Act, shall take effect on June 1, 2021.

bill.official-title-amendment: Amend the title so as to read: A bill to promote competition by preventing the transfer of actions arising under the antitrust laws in which a State is a complainant..

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
